pdhp327:1: The people give according to faith, according to their confidence,
pdhp327:2: herein the one who becomes depressed because of food and drink given to others,
pdhp327:3: does not, either by day or night, attain to good concentration.
pdhp328:1: For the one in whom this depression is cut off, destroyed at the root, dug up,
pdhp328:2: does, by day and night, attain to good concentration.
pdhp329:1: Like a good horse touched by the whip, living ardent and spiritually intense.
pdhp329:2: Having faith, virtue and energy, concentration and insight into the Dhamma,
pdhp329:3: well-established in patience, meekness and concentration, they have come to the essence of wisdom and learning.
pdhp330:1: He who acquires faith and wisdom unsurpassed in this very life,
pdhp330:2: has great wealth in the world, other wealth, though great, is useless.
pdhp331:1: The faithful one who is possessed of virtue, and has wealth and fame,
pdhp331:2: whatever district he resorts to, right there and then he is worshipped.
pdhp332:1: Faith is a person’s travelling companion, he would not accept travelling without faith,
pdhp332:2: from that there will be fame and renown for him, and when he abandons the body he goes to heaven.
pdhp333:1: The person who is beyond mere faith, who knows that which is unmade, who has cut off rebirth-linking,
pdhp333:2: who has destroyed the occasion, who has thrown out hope and desire, is surely the person supreme.
pdhp334:1: It is rare the arising of Buddhas, rare the teaching of the Dhamma,
pdhp334:2: it is rare to acquire faith, rare is the life of mortals.
pdhp335:1: For the one with unsettled mind, who does not know the True Dhamma,
pdhp335:2: whose confidence is wavering, wisdom is unfulfilled.
pdhp336:1: For one who has a mind lacking confidence, that is base or agitated,
pdhp336:2: and frequently impetuous, it is not possible to understand the Dhamma.
pdhp337:1: He who has removed impetuosity, displeasure from his mind,
pdhp337:2: with confident mind, happy, he can understand well-spoken words.
pdhp338:1: Acquiring birth as a human, or going to the heavens,
pdhp338:2: or having sole sovereignty over the earth—better is the fruit of stream-entry.
pdhp339:1: He whose faith in the Realised One is well-established and unmoveable,
pdhp339:2: whose virtue is beautiful, praised by the noble ones,
pdhp340:1: who has confidence in the Saṅgha, who sees uprightly,
pdhp340:2: he they say is ‘not poor’, his life is not in vain.
pdhp341:1: Therefore with faith, virtue, confidence and insight into Dhamma,
pdhp341:2: a sage should devote himself to the essence of the Buddhas’ dispensation.
